medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe short stature and skeletal deformities in an 11-year-old female patient.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Short stature was evident at birth. The patient had always been very short, with significant limb deformities, and was followed by the Skeletal Dysplasia team since the age of 8 years. She underwent surgery for bilateral severe Madelung deformities at the age of 10 years.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Combined diagnoses of Turner syndrome and Langer mesomelic dysplasia (LMD) identified at age 10. Had surgery on the left forearm at age 10. No history of ear infections.
medical_history.family_history: Mother's height was 152.4 cm; both grandmothers were 60 inches tall. An older sibling is of average stature. The mother carries a deletion encompassing a marker associated with LWD (Leri-Weill dyschondrosteosis).
